Diagnosis: Ectopic ACTH secretion (paraneoplastic syndrome) Justification: Certain tumors (small cell lung carcinoma, neuroendocrine tumors) produce ACTH, causing cortisol excess; however, less common in this age group without other systemic signs.  6. Diagnosis: PCOS (Polycystic Ovary Syndrome) Justification: Common in women (excluded here due to male gender), causes weight gain and skin changes but less likely in a male patient.  8. Diagnosis: Hypothyroidism Justification: Can cause fatigue, weight gain, dry skin, and mood changes, but skin striae and profound face/abdominal fat are less characteristic.  9. Diagnosis: Psychiatric conditions (depression, somatization) Justification: Fatigue and mood changes may be psychological but do not explain physical signs like striae and fat redistribution very well.  10.
